isfsm.description: True if the graph represents a Finite State Machine, in which case it can contain an incoming edge from nowhere (the start edge) and can have 'accept' nodes

noderadius.description: The radius of a node in pixels

fontsize.description: The font size in points used for node and edge labels.

helpmenutext.description: Text which if non-empty replaces the standard help menu text defined in the CodeRunner language strings

textoffset.description: The offset in pixels of a link label from its link

locknodepositions.description: If true, prevents the user from moving nodes. Useful when the answer box is preloaded with a graph that the student has to annotate by changing node or edge labels or by adding/removing edges. Note, though that nodes can still be added and deleted. See locknodeset.

locknodeset.description: If true, prevents the the user from adding or deleting nodes or toggling node types to/from acceptors.

locknodelabels.description: If true, prevent the user from editing node labels. This will also prevent any new nodes having non-empty labels

lockedgepositions.description: If true prevents the user from dragging edges to change their curvature. Possibly useful if the answer box is preloaded with a graph that the student has to annotate by changing node or edge labels or by adding/removing edges. Also ensures that edges added by a student are straight, e.g. to draw a polygon on a set of given points. Note, though that edges can still be added and deleted. See lockedgeset.

lockedgeset.description: If true prevents the user from adding or deleting edges.

lockedgelabels.description: True to prevent the user from editing edge labels. This also prevents any new edges from having labels.
